Enum Square

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Square>
com.github.bhlangonijr.chesslib.Square
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Square>, java.lang.constant.Constable
public enum Square extends Enum<Square>
All possible squares on a board.

Each value defines a single square, except for the special value NONE which identifies that no square is selected or assigned.

  • Nested Class Summary

    • values

      public static Square[] values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      Returns:
      an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

    • valueOf

      public static Square valueOf(String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
      Returns:
      the enum constant with the specified name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
      NullPointerException - if the argument is null

    • encode

      public static Square encode(Rank rank, File file)
      Encodes a rank and a file into a square, returning the square value corresponding to the input values.
      Parameters:
      rank - a rank in the board
      file - a file in the board
      Returns:
      the square that corresponds to the rank and file provided in input

    • fromValue

      public static Square fromValue(String v)
      Returns a square given its name.

      Same as invoking valueOf(String).

      Parameters:
      v - name of the square
      Returns:
      the square with the specified name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name does not correspond to any square

    • squareAt

      public static Square squareAt(int index)
      Returns the square at position index in the board, or NONE if the index is invalid. Valid indexes are included between 0 (A1) and 63 (H8), increasing with files and ranks respectively. Thus, index 1 corresponds to B1 and index 8 to A2.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the square
      Returns:
      the corresponding square, if index is valid, otherwise NONE

    • getSideSquares

      public Square[] getSideSquares()
      Returns the squares on the side of the given square. A square on the side is on the same rank and in adjacent files. For instance, side squares of D4 are the two adjacent squares on the 4th rank, C4 and E4.

      Note that squares on the edge files (A and H) have only one side square instead of two (on files B and G respectively).

      Returns:
      the side squares of this square

    • getRank

      public Rank getRank()
      Returns the rank of the square.
      Returns:
      the rank of the square

    • getFile

      public File getFile()
      Returns the file of the square.
      Returns:
      the file of the square

    • value

      public String value()
      Returns the name of the square.
      Returns:
      the name of the square

    • getBitboard

      public long getBitboard()
      Returns the bitboard representation of this square, that is, the single bit in a 64-bits bitmap at the same index of this square. If square is NONE, an empty bitboard is returned.
      Returns:
      the bitboard representation of this square, as a long value

    • isLightSquare

      public boolean isLightSquare()
      Returns whether this is a light-square or not (i.e. a dark-square).
      Returns:
      true if the square is a light-square
